channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Ex-NSA Chief Paul Nakasone Has a Warning for the Tech World
item.description: At the Defcon security conference in Las Vegas on Friday, Nakasone tried to thread the needle in a politically fraught moment while hinting at major c...

item.title: Impersonators are targeting companies with fake TechCrunch outreach
item.description: Hi, thanks as always for reading TechCrunch. We want to talk with you quickly about something important. We’ve discovered that scammers are impersonat...

item.title: Hackers Went Looking for a Backdoor in High-Security Safes—and Now Can Open Them in Seconds
item.description: Security researchers found two techniques to crack at least eight brands of electronic safes—used to secure everything from guns to narcotics—that are...

item.title: The Vibes-Based Pricing of ‘Pro’ AI Software
item.description: In this episode of Uncanny Valley, we're talking about why some chatbot subscriptions are so expensive and how these premium prices were determined on...

item.title: Don’t let your competitor steal the brand spotlight — secure your exhibit table at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
item.description: For 20 years, startups have come to TechCrunch Disrupt to meet their first investors, land their biggest partnerships, and spark the idea that takes t...

item.title: Truth Social’s New AI Chatbot Is Donald Trump’s Media Diet Incarnate
item.description: Truth Search AI appears to rely heavily on conservative outlet Fox News to answer even the most basic questions.

item.title: Join Our Next Livestream: What GPT-5 Means for ChatGPT Users
item.description: On August 14, bring your questions about OpenAI's latest model, GPT-5, and what it means for the future of chatbots.

item.title: Former Googlers’ AI startup OpenArt now creates ‘brain rot’ videos in just one click
item.description: OpenArt launched a new feature to help creators make AI-generated brain rot videos.

item.title: Sam Altman addresses ‘bumpy’ GPT-5 rollout, bringing 4o back, and the ‘chart crime’
item.description: The Reddit AMA got spicy as users peppered OpenAI with questions, and some asked the company to bring back its previous model.

item.title: RIP, Microsoft Lens, a simple little app that’s getting replaced by AI
item.description: Microsoft is killing Lens, a handy mobile scanning app with over 90 million downloads.
